1.text: Purchase sea bass fillets or fillet a sea bass that you caught yourself.

2.text: Score the skin side of a sea bass fillet lightly using a sharp knife.

3.text: Brush or rub olive oil onto both sides of the sea bass.

4.text: Season the fillet on both sides with salt and pepper.

5.text: Add additional dry herbs and spices to season the fish if you want.

6.text: Preheat your grill to high heat.

7.text: Scrape and oil your grill grate.

8.text: Grill the fish skin-side-down for about 7 minutes.

9.text: Turn the sea bass fillet over to the flesh side and grill it for another 6-7 minutes.

10.text: Remove the sea bass from your grill and place it on a plate or platter.

11.text: Add grilled or roasted potatoes to your serving plate for a hearty side.

12.text: Garnish the plate with dill and lemon wedges for a classic serving presentation.

13.text: Drizzle the sea bass with olive oil or melted butter for extra flavor.
